course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Environmental Science
course.description: This course introduces students to the general concepts of environment, natural resources, and sustainable development. The topics include pressing global, regional and local environmental changes; life-supporting systems of our planet; biodiversity and its conservation; atmosphere, water resources, and their pollutions; solid and hazardous waste management; environmental health and sustainable development. Throughout the course, students will gain a sufficient background and a better understanding of the root-causes of the upfront environmental issues. They will also become more aware of their role, as citizens, in environmental protection and sustainable development.

reviews.author: Toygg
reviews.title: Ice is Ko (Cold)
reviews.comment_content:
[NTU Exchange Student Review]
[南洋理工大學exchange student嘅review]

Course Assessment Breakdown
Midterm test (ALL MCQs): 40%
Finals (MCQ+4 short answered questions): 60%

Midterm test(全部都係MCQs): 40%
Finals(MCQs+四條短問題): 60%
reviews.comment_teaching:
For fellow exchange students who are not used to the HKUST system, this course is taught by 3 different professors: Prof Ice Ko, Prof Qian, Prof Cindy Lam.

Prof Ice Ko[Ice is Ko(Cold)]
She taught the first half of the course content until the midterm test. On the first lesson and every subsequent lesson, she kept emphasizing about the importance of interaction between human and educator which is something that YouTube can never replace. Besides, she also kept insisting that the last 3-4 rows are left vacant and those sitting there should shift forward. As for the delivery of the course content, her PowerPoint slides are quite different (extra content) from the PDF files that we are given. If you want to get a good grade instead of just aiming for a pass as an exchange student, please take notes. I am really impressed with her command of English, her accent (sounds like Received Pronunciation) is super easy to follow. During lectures, she talked about environmental issues in a very biased way and she shouldn’t even mention her opinion and religious beliefs about them at all.  Instead, she should be neutral and let students form their own opinions about those things. Finally, her classes have never ended on time. Thank your lucky stars if it ends 10 minutes after the lesson ending time on the schedule.

Mid-semester Test [Refer to Confession #Fys3162 on HKUST FYS Secrets 4.0]
It started 15 minutes late and the counting of exam scripts took another 15 minutes. The funniest thing is when there are at least 6 TAs (Postgraduate students) trying to count about 130+ exam scripts again and again with the aid of multiple calculators.

Prof Qian
His lectures were super boring, please have a good night of rest before the lecture or drink a caffeinated beverage. With regards to his English accent, it is much worst than Prof Ice Ko but he is still understandable overall. Another thing that I want to highlight is the fact that his lecture slides are referenced off from Wikipedia (/Facepalms/). If you expect an early lunch, you are in luck as he usually ends the lecture slightly earlier than the stipulated time.

Prof Cindy Lam
Her command of English pales in comparison to Prof Ice in terms of fluency. As for the course content, it should be manageable as the topics were covered in Geography classes before. Like Prof Qian, she also ends the lecture earlier than the stipulated time.

新嚟嘅exchange students, 有三個professor教呢個course.

Prof Ice Ko[Ice is Ko(Cold)]
頭一半嘅content呢係佢教直到midterm. 每一堂佢都會喺度講 interaction between 學生同埋老師係好重要 ,YouTube係絕對取代唔到嘅.
同埋佢好鍾意叫人哋呢唔好坐最後嗰第三第四排. 至於嗰個內容呢, 佢嗰個PowerPoint係唔同嘅, 係加咗料嘅版本. 如果你想攞靚grade嘅話,唔該抄下Notes. 佢D英文真係好好呀,好容易明白佢講嘅嘢. 不過有時佢會 用一啲好bias嘅方法講啲environmental嘅嘢, 佢係唔應該提到佢嘅諗法啦同埋宗教信仰. 佢應該係用一個好neutral嘅viewpoint 理解啲嘢囉, 等學生自己有佢哋自己嘅思想. 最後,佢啲堂呢係唔會早End囉. 如果佢嘅堂遲十分鐘end已經算好鬼好㗎喇.

Mid-semester Test [Refer to Confession #Fys3162 on HKUST FYS Secrets 4.0]
遲咗15分鐘開始, 數捲又要多15分鐘,總共半個鐘 .最好笑係 六個TA用好幾部計數機計嚟計去都計唔到.

Prof Qian
佢啲堂好悶, 前一晚早啲瞓或者飲杯奶茶或者咖啡. 佢啲英文呢就冇Prof Ice咁好啦,不過都聽得明嘅. 另一樣我想提到嘅嘢就係佢啲slides喺Wiki嗰度嚟㗎. 如果你想早d食午餐呢,咁你就有運行啦因為佢會早d落堂.

Prof Cindy Lam
佢啲英文呢就冇阿Prof Ice咁流利. Course嘅content應該ok, 之前Geography應該學過. 佢啲堂都會早d完嘅 = 早d食午餐呢.

reviews.author: chillica
reviews.title: Absolutely disastrous
reviews.comment_content:
Very basic biology and chemistry, although the environmental health topic is quite interesting.

Do not expect to learn much new content if you have a science background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The organisation of the exams (especially the midterm) is absolutely disastrous. In both exams we encountered technical difficulties which led to a very late start of exams. Many of the questions in the midterm, covering Prof Ice Ko's content, were extremely irrelevant and ambiguous. It included content from lectures not within the exam scope, and makes you feel that there is no meaning for revising for the exam.

Even so, Prof. Ice Ko is not willing to accept students' negative comments. According to her, the blame is on the students - we are expected to "integrate the knowledge" and "fully understand the content" in order to answer her obscure questions. The public chatroom is disabled after the midterm and students can be muted if they start to criticise the midterm exam.

However, Dr. Cynthia Yau is a patient and nice teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
Disastrous. There are many people who found the final easy but got a bad grade.

The midterm exam, as stated before, is extremely irrelevant and ambiguous. It is definitely not the fairest way to test a student's ability. However, the Dr.Yau's part of the final was fine and Dr. Yau's questions were easy to understand.

The midterm scores are released, but there is zero transparency for the final. For some reason, the midterm scores are also muted later on.
reviews.comment_workload: There is only a midterm and a final so there should be very little workload.

reviews.author: Pico
reviews.title: Need A? Just use your logic.
reviews.comment_content:
No need to buy the textbook, but the slides are mainly derived from Cunningham, W.P. and Cunningham, M.A. (2017) Principles of Environmental Science: Inquiry and Applications. Eighth Edition. McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc.

Part 1: Matter and Energy (Chapters 2 & 13) Ice
+ Matter and Energy
Part 2: Understanding Our Environment (Chapter 1) Qian
+ Pressing Global Environmental Issues
+ Global Effort in Addressing Environmental Challenges
+ Hong Kong Environmental Issues
Part 3: Life and Biomes (Chapters 3, 5 & 6) Qian
+ Life Supporting Systems—Species, Population, and Community
+ Life Supporting Systems—Ecosystem
+ Climates and Earth’s Major Biomes
Part 4: Biodiversity (Chapter 5) Ice
+ Biodiversity and Its Significance
+ Threats to Biodiversity
Part 5: Human Populations (Chapter 4) Ice
+ Human Population Dynamics and Control
Part 6: Food and Nutrition (Chapter 7) Wang
+ Nutrition and Food Supply
Part 7: Environmental Health and Toxicology (Chapter 8) Wang
+ Environmental Toxicology and Health
Part 8: Atmosphere and Pollution (Chapter 9) Wang
+ Atmosphere and Climate
+ Air Pollution
Part 9: Water Resources and Pollution (Chapter 10) Wang
+ Water Usage
+ Water Pollution
Part 10: Solid and Hazardous Wastes (Chapter 13) Cindy
+ Wastes and Disposal
reviews.comment_teaching:
The four of them are overall boring, but you should definitely come to Ice and Cindy's lectures because they are the ones with the least boring lecture.
Both Ice and Cindy's slides on Canvas are not complete, but Ice doesn't want you to take a photo of her slides during her class, while Cindy seemed fine with it. But tbh don't even bother completing Cindy's slides because they're basically useless for the exam.
What I liked about Ice’s lecture is she gave quite a lot of case study, and made the lectures more comprehensible and generally easier to memorize.
Prof. Qian may not be the best at teaching, but I can see that he is a great professor with very deep knowledge of what he's teaching. If you concentrate on what he's saying, you might notice that he repeated the same thing over and over, and that's like a sign that it's going to appear on the exam.
I think Prof. Wang is the worst at teaching, but I would like to give applause on his very short slides, making my finals a little bit easier. I kinda hate him because he's the one who proposed to make short questions during the final exam. But then again, the purpose of enrolling yourself in a university is to study, so...
Cindy is a very nice person. I think she taught us in the most ideal pace out of the four. She doesn’t have anything particularly interesting about her lectures, but what’s wrong with being mediocre? :)
reviews.comment_grading:
It’s appropriate and quite fair. I'm guessing the "about" is to adjust the curve.
Midterm Exam: (about 30%)
37/50 mean: 36 s.d: 5.7 highest: 47
Final Exam: (about 50%)
82.5/100 mean: 59.1 s.d: 13.5 highest: 94.5
Short Essay: (about 20%)
16/20 mean 14.6 highest: 20
Result: A

The midterm covers Part 1-3, while the final covers Part 4-10.
Memorizing the slides might seem like the way to go, but lemme tell you, don't waste your time remembering everything on the lecture slides. Just skim through the slides and use your common sense to finish the exam because it's seriously easy.
The midterm is 50 MCs and they give you 50 mins.
The final is 20 MCs and 5 short questions (yeah, short questions but freakin long answers), duration 2 hours. For the short questions, it’s only about Prof. Wang’s lectures, something like cycles, and bullet points style questions. I made up some useless shit for the short questions, but when I checked my paper I got full marks! I guess as long as it made sense, they didn't care much about the detail. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
For Ice's lecture, memorize even the tiny bit details on the pictures and diagrams because they actually appeared on the exam. I learned this the hard way, so don't let your midterm score suffer as mine did. But worry not, Ice's slides are much less compared to the others.
For Cindy's, however, don't even bother reading the slides for revision. It's useless honestly. The questions were very simple and straight-forward, just use your logic to answer it.
reviews.comment_workload:
No attendance, homework, etc.
Only a short essay about an environmental issue, 400 words, with guidelines to follow.
Although it’s due in 3 months, I did mine on the same day with the deadline. But it’s possible to get a perfect score if you do enough research and whatsoever.
Other than that, only midterm and final. If you have good common sense, this is the perfect course for you.

reviews.author: Psyche
reviews.comment_content:
The topics in summer semester would be less than that in Fall or Spring. The content includes: a general picture of Environmental Science, Matter & Energy (Chemistry-related), Biodiversity, Population, Atmosphere, Water Resources, Pollution Problems, etc. The content is fruitful and gives students some basic ideas of Environmental Science. Quite easy for Science students to catch up.

The video project requires students to form a group of 5, producing a 5-mins video about any topic in Environmental Science. There will be a workshop teaching the students how to use Adobe Premiere Pro. Students can borrow equipments from the library for video production (Camera, video recorder, etc.) after joining the workshop. The workshop is quite useful. Common topics of the video project includes food waste, waste treatment and pollution problems. The project will be graded in terms of organization, critical thinking, creativity & teamwork.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Qian: Effective teaching, mainly talks about climate change and different World Climate Conferences.
Exam tips for his part: Doing revision on the PowerPoint slides is enough. Make sure that you are familiar with the focuses and important information about the world conferences.

Prof. Ice Ko: Her English is good and easy to understand. Her teaching is the most interesting part of the course. Make sure you don't use your mobile phone, take photos of her PowerPoint slides and sleep in the lesson. She will ask you questions even if you seat at the back.
Exam tips for her part: Attending all her lectures is important. Take notes on the PowerPoint slides which are not included in your handout. Exam questions would be set on topics being discussed & additional information of the PowerPoint slides in the lesson. She's nice if you are a decent student.

Dr. Cindy Lam: Her PowerPoint slides are too informative that she taught a bit rush. (She promised not to set exam questions on topics that she had no time to teach but finally she set one.)
Exam tips for her part: Attending lectures is useful, a small proportion of exam questions would be set on information given in the lecture. Don't miss the small tables and details in the PowerPoint slides. Her part is the most time-consuming when doing revision because there are so much information that you need to recite. Reading the textbook helps.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade course :)
Midterm: 50 Multiple-Choice Questions (~25%)
Final: 80 Multiple-Choice Questions (~40%)
Group Project: Produce a 5-mins video, can be any topic related to Environmental Science (~35%)
reviews.comment_workload: Time consuming and intensive if you enroll this course in the summer semester. Although they have reduced the topics, workload is still very heavy. The video-making process is frustrating if you are not an expert. Yet, it did helped me in gaining experiences in video-making. I used the software provided by the school library computer, so I even need to go back to UST on Sunday for my project. After that, you'll need to analyze 24 videos produced by other groups. It costs me a few days to finish and it counts for 10% inside the group project. The server they used for viewing the videos is slow, this wasted me some more time.

reviews.author: 燃燒中的GPA
reviews.title: 無science background但數學底唔差既人想fulfill SSC-S&T揀ELEC1010好過
reviews.comment_content:
睇attachment, 同PHYS1003差唔多, 又係一堂一份PPT

如果你有science background既話, 呢個course大部分內容你都應該學過, 唔好expect會學到好多新野

上半部分內容都幾悶, 如果你高中讀過Chemistry同Biology你應該一早學過晒, 而且好多野同其他courses重疊, 例如:

Part 1 Lecture 4 (Earth Summits, Conventions on CO2 Emission), Lecture 5 (Law of the Sea, Conventions on Ocean Dumping & Mining): SOSC1270講過

Part 2 Matter and Energy: 高中Chem同 Bio野 + thermodynamics (PHYS1003/PHYS1112講過)

Part 3 Lecture 10 (Life Supporting Systems – Species, Population, Community), Lecture 11 (Life Supporting Systems – Community, Ecosystem): 高中Bio野

上半部分俾我既感覺係夾硬砌出黎咁, 到下半部分內容先似樣返少少


(For your reference only)
今個sem比較重要(考得比較多)既Lectures:

Midterm: Lecture 7, 9-11

Final MC: Lecture 15, 21-23
Final Short Questions: Lecture 14 (population), 19 (greenhouse gases), 21 (desalination), 24 (microplastics)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Qian:
聽唔明佢d英文, 字與字之間會停頓幾秒, 逐隻逐隻字"chok"出黎, 我上左幾堂之後發覺真係頂唔順佢d英文, 走左好多堂
(嗱, 即係咁, UST學生最關心grading眾所周知, 我估大部分人reg 科之前都會上ust space睇下個course有無伏先, 由於之前有人透露LIFS1030考過chemical equations, 相信無science background 既同學都會避之則吉, 除非佢地對environmental science極有興趣, 否則都唔會take LIFS1030燒自己GPA, 所以我估讀得LIFS1030既人大部分都有science background, 跟住好笑既野就黎啦, Lecture 9 Matter and Energy 係d簡單science野, 大部分人都應該一早學過, 都唔會expect呢個topic上lecture會有d咩elaboration, 加上Qian又唔係教得好, 時間又唔好 (16:30-17:50), 好多人走左Lecture 9, 呢樣野係好正常既, 之後Qian竟然send email屌柒我地走佢堂, 又凶鳩我地話以前d人LIFS1030爛grade甚至fail係因為走堂, 我睇完真係得啖笑, Qian實在太離地, 究竟佢有無諗過點解咁多人走佢堂? 定係佢FF好多學生都無science background要上佢lecture先識?)

Ice Ko (guest lecturer, 教Lecture 7 & 8):
好似中學上訓導主任堂咁, 唔好遲到, 唔好傾計, 唔好玩電話, 唔好影佢既slides (佢上堂用既PPT會有extra內容, 記得帶筆去take notes, 會考), 會叫人答問題, 不過佢教得好好, 只係上堂規矩比較嚴, 同埋會講得比較快

Cindy:
教得都唔錯, 唔會教得太快, style同Ice Ko有少少似, 佢個PPT又係會有extra內容, 不過佢唔介意你影佢既slides, 其實我真係唔明點解咁多人鬧Cindy, 雖然佢教得唔算出色, 但至少你會聽得明佢d英文先 (可能因為Qian d英文太難頂), 我都好少走Cindy堂

結論:
Qian: 唔上都罷, 反正你都唔會有心機聽, 無謂嘥自己時間
Ice Ko, Cindy: 無咩特別事就盡量上足啦
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm (50%): 1 hour, 80 MCQs, Lectures 1-12
Mean: 54.0, SD: 9.98, Max: 73 (out of 80)

Final (50%): 2 hours, 100 points in total, Lectures 14-25
Part I: MC (60 MCQs x 1 point each = 60 points)
Part II: Short Questions (4 Short Questions x 10 points each = 40 points)
Mean: 57.0, SD: 13.6, Max: 85 (out of 100)

我:
Midterm: 70/80 (+1.6 SD)
Final: 78/100 (+1.54 SD)

Overall: 82.75%
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
雖然得midterm同final, 但lecture notes內容好多, 每次exam要考11-12份lecture notes, 加埋都有成~500頁, 最好預留多少少時間溫, 同埋LIFS1030無得用cheat sheet, 你要背到好熟

MC可以點溫?大家應該識做 (唔明我講咩既話請睇其他人既review)
小心Midterm份MC (好聽d講叫問得深入, 難聽d講叫濕鳩), 例如:
某個research幾時開始做 (考埋d咁既野到底有咩意義?), Earth’s surface有幾多%係international waters
同埋小心單位 (溫度: deg C/deg F, 距離: nautical miles/km)

Short Questions大概會點考? 呢個sem就係類似咁考:
-What are … & …? Give one example to each of them. (提供…的定義及例子)
-Account for the changes of … (解釋...的變化)
-Explain the operational differences between … & …(解釋...運作上的差異)
-List out two/three factors/impacts/sources/benefits of … (列舉2/3個…的因素/影響/來源/好處)
-Which greenhouse gas is …? (寫出greenhouse gas的名稱, 要識串字!!)

呢個sem既Short Questions好似考左都幾多lecture講過但lecture notes無寫既野, 如果走得太多Cindy堂可能會唔識答

以前考過chemical equations, 唔知之後會唔會再考, 不過short questions都係無路捉, Good Luck :)

reviews.author: mc_cch
reviews.title: Pay attention to the PPT slides
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting content, a brief introduction about environmental science, which is related to our daily life.

However, some topics may overlap with other science subjects (e.g. Chemistry/Physics/Geography), as well as high school knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Ice KO (A+)

I like her teaching style as she focused on interaction with students in the lecture. Her questions did arouse our interests in environmental science! The PPT slides prepared by Prof. Ice KO were attractive that you could follow what she was talking about easily during the lecture!   However, some minor key points were missing--that's to say--she wanted you all to attend her class and jot down the notes!

Dr. Cynthia YAU (B+ / A-)
Dr. YAU was also very nice and patient that she always offered assistance to students after class. Hoverer, her PPT slides were not well-organised that you had to pay attention in the lecture, and try to create your own notes after reading her learning materials. She also forgot to reply to my email.......
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is OK la

Final: 74/80

>>> A-

*****Plz spend more time on their lecture notes.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload > as long as u get familiarised with the content.

reviews.author: Wong123
reviews.comment_content: A lot of content is about basic biology such as biosphere. A lot of the information of the slides are from Wikipedia. Therefore it is not easy for you to memorize everything. The lecture can be quite boring sometimes.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching method is quite direct. Mostly is through the usage of Powerpoint. One thing to remember is that some of the contents they mentioned cannot be found on the ppt. Thus it is important to attend every lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: It is not easy to get a high grade in this course. It is very hard to get a high score during the midterm and exam. It is because they will even ask irrelevant data in multiple choice questions. It is not recommended to take this course if one is not good at memorizing course materials.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload during the semester is not high. But during the final and midterm exam can be quite intense. The project is not hard to complete as well. The good thing is they do not require a project presentation and any regular assignment.

reviews.title: Take this course, if you crave boredom
reviews.comment_content:
Plz refer to Teaching section.

Last sentence:
"Remember, you always have a choice." (from a best professor in UST)

Last last message:
If you are unfortunately in this course, don't force yourself to memorize as some other comments suggest.
Always remember that you have the freedom. No one stops you from googling more extra materials for complete understanding.

Eg: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCylCbuzRsB92Gc1l8ru6VIg is a good resource

Though it is entirely out-syll and not required, it just depends on how much requirement you have for yourself, what life you want to live. Instead of sighing or lamenting. when you cannot change the environment, you can only change your attitude.

Of course, best practice is to avoid this course.

PS: I disregarded some other reviews as haters' comments before, and now I realize they are grounded. I don't ask you to trust my review either as I can understand your feelings, but please think carefully. Really, really, carefully.

Yours faithfully,
Someone Suffered

[To be typed]
reviews.comment_teaching:
*Caution: Read this fully, or at least read till the second paragraph. NEVER ONLY READ THE FIRST PARAGRAPH!

(Qian, Peiyuan)
Well to be fair, he has some good points to note if you brainstorm them intensively. He usually smiled, and produced words as if giving a speech all the time with extensive hand gestures. He appeared to be a great speaker visually and looked very confident of his teaching. It is easy to feel that he has a good personality, and from his qualifications, he should have great academic ability too. Also, the powerpoints have much content.

Yet maybe it is a troll by the God, or because of whatever made-up excuses, he has unmatching, if not zero, teaching ability.

I mean, the fact that he was smiling had a great 違和感 (aka a feeling of violating harmony) with most students who were desperately maintaining a polite face, giving up life with a poker face, or rebelling and yelling "why am I here" internally with a black face. He seemed to be indulged in his self-created zone of praise and acknowledgement and said firmly to himself, "my people love me". (Slide note: he used "people" to address students all the time) Or, maybe he realized it, but he had no other choices but continuing squeezing a smile to ease the dull, uncomfortable and awkward atmosphere. After all, we should think emphatically too. However, who created this atmosphere from scratch?

I mean, when he "produced words", he was doing anything but passing knowledge. Sometimes, he was basically reading out slides as if university students, having needed to pass the not-so-basic language requirements, were basically illiterate at all. Even if you are, unfortunately, really illiterate, you have Google Translate. Given that your "reading" speed is probably 500% faster than his "reading" speed, it is literally, if you are literate, a complete waste of precious time. Sometimes, in fact, he would talk about new concepts (maybe not in ppt) straightly, just, which means, without any definition, concreteness, or explanation. It seems he assumed us illiterate people understood all specialist jargon. If you are to learn for curiosity, for appreciation of the nature, for a growth of brain and heart, you will probably be brutally disappointed. If you are to learn for grades, for requirement, or for flexing, then you are lucky - you will only be slightly disappointed. You only have to memorize everything, abandon your soul, and pretend that you understand anything, you will be fine. For me, I tried to think immediately or resorted to Google lastly once I found a concept unclear until I understood it. (and realizing once and once again Google deserves an A+ in Teaching). But as soon as I did that, our dearest professor was reading out another slide. So what is the point of attending "lectures"?????

I mean, when he was giving out the speech, he was like a failing Ted Talk speaker wannabe. As if the above are not bad enough, his speech were characteristically inserted with frequent unwanted, redundant, and ridiculously lengthy break, attempting to murder your passion for this world. It was like 5 seconds every single time, 4 times every single minute. Imagine your life was like that and you had a lifespan of 90, then you LOST 30 years completely! To think emphatically again, maybe they were intended for digestion? Com'on, digest 1+1=2 in 5 seconds, and digest Riemann hypothesis in 5 seconds too! Plus, they were random, unpredictable, and scattered everywhere to 反高潮 (verb of anti-climax), as if there were any.

I mean, his hand gestures, were indeed good and I have nothing more to add, except being wasted, like his talents.

I mean, his appearing as a great speaker visually contradicts the very nature of "speaker" for which dictionary definition gives "A person who speaks." (Oxford). He was like a master of table manners except that instead of savoring food, he was vomiting. He was like a rich guy living in a house of gold yet with an empty heart. He was like a spelling bee champion who could not compose a single sentence. Idk what the hell I am writing. In short, it is simply a waste. Yet, that "Idk what the hell is going" captures his lectures perfectly.

I mean, confidence is good, but reflection upon oneself is equally important, given the countless thumbs-downs in the reviews above and below. In Chinese we have “人無恥則無敵” (If you are shameless, you are invincible). Though personally NOT agreeing with this statement (or I would give an A for his teaching), he was a living example. To be honest, did he know his popularity actually? Did he ever have a slight thought of trying to improve?

*The ppt are, as expected, also extremely bad, but sorry that I don't have time to write completely currently. See the attachment and judge objectively yourself.

(Cindy Lam)
Haven't attended. Can't tell.
reviews.comment_grading:
Unexpectedly lenient.

1-2 days revision before each:
Mid-term: ~70/80 (mean: 54.6, high: 73)
Final: ~70/100 (mean: 57, high: 85)

Eventually an A. I am genuinely grateful about it.

Tips 1: Google some keywords.

Tips 2: See other comments you will know there is long q for Final. The marking is STRICT, closely following ppt's wording is required.

Final reminder: I hope neither of the tips would be useful to anyone in the future.

reviews.author: Weird Guy
reviews.comment_content: The topics covered include Biodiversity, Atmosphere, Air and Water Pollution. The topics about conferences and landfill names are extremely boring. This course requires absolutely no understanding and plain memorising about the facts and figures. A nightmare for those interested in learning something from this course. The textbook is not of any use, just memorise the slides.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Only Dr. Ice KO's lectures were interesting. There was active class participation and she showed us interesting videos. You have to attend her classes as she discusses slides that will not be shown to us later. Questions from her part are based on these slides and the class discussions. She is very strict, and does not like people using their mobile phones during her teachings.

The lectures of the other three professors are extremely boring. They show no interest in their teaching and can put you to sleep during the classes. Prof. Qian's research may be excellent, but is simply not a good teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you want to take this course, I would recommend you to take this course during summer as the grading is much, much better then. The midterm and final exams are MCs with no emphasis on understanding of the concepts. People who like memorising will love this pattern.
This course also consists of making a 5-minute video on any environment-related topic. You will be in a team of 5. The video is tedious, if you do not have good groupmates. You can choose any topic, but try to make your video interesting.
The midterm contribute to about 25% of the overall grade. 35% goes to the video, and the remaining 40% goes to the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite high. Once you have submitted your video, you need to evaluate 20 other videos, which is extremely time-consuming.
For the midterm and final exams, this course requires extensive memorisation of the small facts and figures. Just read the slides, the textbook will be of no use.

Don't recommend taking it when Ice Ko is teaching. Her ppt often has some slides not included in the handouts which are important and will appear in exams, she will suggest you TAKE NOTES tho.
Also, she would say that the exam tests on your common sense, but actually didn't mention the answers in lectures.

reviews.title: Prepare to struggle if you don't go out-syl before enrolling
reviews.comment_content:
Quality and interesting content if you are interested in at least ALMOST ALL of the below (not exhaustive) subjects/specializations:
Geography, meteorology, history, physics, chemistry and biology
Or:
Willing to recite from/research on almost all of the course content AND you are good at LS in DSE
Otherwise, prepare to be bored and then fall asleep in lectures because you can't catch up with the content.

Major contents:
Before mid term:
Environmental issues (Global Warming, tectonic movements, El Niño and La Niña, ITCZ, ocean dumping, population, etc - with tons of history-related content): tons of conferences, terms, unheard of concepts
Biodiversity and life-supporting systems (ecosystems): mostly bio content
Matter, Energy and Resources: mostly a concentrated lecture consisting of fundamental physics and chemistry (one lecture only)

After mid-term:
Better for your brain as there is significantly less content after the mid-term for most of you - most of them should be at least hinted in LS in secondary schools
Food safety/ environmental health/ toxicology: not as complicated compared to remembering factors
Pollution and Waste: lectures are relatively light weighted
Both topics should have been covered in M5 and M6 (with a little bit of M2) in LS. Not very much unfamiliar content for an average UST student.

(P.S. in this sem, the scope of mid term and final are separate - only the listed duplicated content after this paragraph are in BOTH assessments)
Duplicates: Pollution (air, water, microplastics etc), environmental issues in HK

Fortunately lecture replays are available - a blessing to most of us.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Cindy Lam: B
Dr Qian (a.k.a. Department Head of Ocean Science): D
Thus there is the overall C rating

Lectures before mid term (with exception to L4) are taught by Qian. As expected, his Putonghua accent and pro-Chinese patriotic tendencies (no offense) are apparent. Sad to say he and his TA ruined the lectures mostly because they both have the tendency to drift too far off the topic over the course of lectures, resulting in L7 almost not being mentioned at all. Significantly higher proportion of students who sleep or even absent in his lectures than of Cindy's. Skipped quite a few lectures on Tuesday before mid term. Be mentally prepared (in multiple aspects) if you were to attend his lectures IRL.

The remaining lectures are taught by Cindy. Relatively more interactions and more comprehensible content. Not as demanding as Qian by all means.

The issue of proliferating grammatical mistakes and rather confusing accents persists in both lecturers - can't blame them because I am slightly more considerate to those who have English as second language. Their accents are far more accessible to some other local students than me do.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair IM(A)O - when applying the common UST grading standard.

Mid term literally kills as the MAX score reached is 70/80 for the entire 20x-student class - my high score in the mid term was purely a fluke and from my prior knowledge in meteorology. Drilled too much into minute details in quite a few questions. Why is it supposed for us to recall which year did somebody start measuring atmospheric CO2 content in Mauna Loa (Hawaii)? (answer: 1958)
Midterm mean: 54.0/80
S.D.: 7.67
My score: 65

Due to special circumstances (everybody here knows what's that about), final exam is conducted online in an open-booked format. MCs (there were 34) become considerably trickier because of that. With two ~200-word-limit short questions within 1 hour. Cindy doesn't care about grammar and prefers point form in answers as mentioned.
Final exam mean: 31.89/50
S.D.: 7.61
Highest Score: 47
Mine: 41

Overall grade: A
(I am able to get this grade only because of my long term memory - almost most content in this review [read: 20 days after final exam] are recalled without any help from lecture notes and online searches. Getting good grades in UST is always that difficult :sigh:)
reviews.comment_workload: Almost zero compulsory workload in this course - the only "workload" is to revise (and likely recite) course contents before mid-term and final exams. Highly suggest to revise AT LEAST two weeks before each test because there is quite a lot of concepts and facts that you need to know (as compared to other introductory courses).

reviews.author: Jeffer Chan
reviews.comment_content: Teaches the basics of Environmental Science from biomes, weather systems, pollution, to cooperation between countries against global climate change. Real life examples, Deep Water Horizon for example, are often included for students to understand more about the real-life scenarios. Students may know better about the place they are living in and the recent controversies on climate change.
reviews.comment_teaching:
All of the lecturers try grabbing the students attention by raising questions for groups to discuss, although students do not really enjoy participating in... The lecturers like to highlight important parts of the notes or add extra information only on their powerpoint. This may encourage students to attend lectures and make exams fair to those who attend lectures.

In particular, Ice KO has a attention-grabbing voice but Cindy LAM is quite flat-toned (possibly due to the less interesting topics she teaches). They both try to be as informative as possibly and is quite willing to answer questions from students.

QIAN taught only one lecture so I am not so sure if he is good or bad.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% group project with intra-group peer evaluation
5% inter-group peer evaluation (comment on other videos)
25% MC midterm
45% MC final

The midterm and final are both MC questions, which are quite easy if you have attended lectures and followed the class. I got about +0.8 SD on miderm, +1 SD on final with basic effort. ~25% from 25%+5% intra- & inter- group evaluations. It results in a A- grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The main workload of this course is the group project, where groups form to create a 5-minute video on any topic under Environmental Science. There is no limitation on the format, therefore it can be a cartoon, video clips from other sources or even self-recorded ones. The video will then be judged by its content and organization, creativity and critical thinking. Students may need to plan ahead as it takes quite some days to finish (my group took 2 weeks to plan and make the video FYI).

After submitting the video project, students need to comment on their group members regarding their performance on the project (by a number rating), and other groups' video (by text). They take less than 2 hours to finish.

Since there are no other assignments, most of the remaining workload is revision. But if you attend lectures and managed to concentrate, a good exam score can be expected. If taken on Summer semester, the workload from project (no hassle from groupmates) and exams is very easy to handle.

reviews.author: Zoe:)
reviews.comment_content:
The teaching content and materials are well-organized and easy to follow in general.
Lecture Topics Include:
- Global environmental challenges (overview of current pressing issues around the world)
- Energy, matter and resource (basic knowledge especially for non-science background ppl)
- Earth Major Biomes (types, distributions, and characteristics of different biomes) (those who like geography might find this topic interesting)
- Biodiversity: significance and threats (with a little case study regarding giant panda)
- Nutrition and food supply (general concepts) (those who studied biology before might have advantage)
- Human Populations (some statistics just for you to understand, least content to memorize)
- Atmosphere and Climate (have to make sure you understand the phenomena like El Nino and La Nina)
- Air Pollution
- Water Resources and pollution
- Wastes and disposal (exams might test on some minor details)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Qian taught only one lesson so I do not have much comment on him.
Prof. Ice Ko was an enthusiastic instructor. She taught in an organized manner and made sure everyone was clear on those important concepts. She would sometimes share with us some thought-provoking quotes, videos and photos. Just make sure you are not attending her class late and do not chat too loud coz she was a bit strict about that.
Prof Cindy Lam took over the class starting from the topic Atmosphere and Climate. She was basically giving out too much information and it is often hard to catch the main point.
reviews.comment_grading:
Group project with intra-group peer evaluation (25%)
Inter-group peer evaluation (5%)
Midterm Examination (25%)
Final Examination (45%)
Examinations are in MC format and noncumulative. Grading is pretty fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable workload. For the 5-min video project, All you need is a group of responsible group mates. The project topic is set by yourselves and it could be any environment-related issues so you might want to choose a topic that information is handy. There are lots of ways to make the video, animations, live-action, stop motions... as long as it is creative. Our group used around four days to finish the whole video. Profs will show two example videos at the beginning and you will know the quality they are looking for.
For the peer evaluations, you will have to evaluate your group mates and also give comments on videos of 10 other groups based on content and organization, and Creativity and Critical Thinking.
For the exams, as the content are quite general and informative, you will really need to revise to get a score above mean.

reviews.comment_grading: Grading was alright, all the exam was multiple choices, lots of route learning and blind memorising is adequate to earn a good grade in this course. No need for high understading of the course.
reviews.comment_workload: The video making is quite hefty, especially if you got a crappy group (CHOOSE YOUR GROUPMATES WISELY PEOPLE).

reviews.author: P.R
reviews.title: My favourite course!!
reviews.comment_content:
If you have taken IB Geography or even just IGCSE Geography, most of the content should be familiar and should be easy to score A range by just attending lectures. It is mostly common knowledge and is very relevant to the world. If you like learning about the environment and animals, you will enjoy this course :)

Content was split into 8 parts (see attached file). However due to not enough time, part 8 was not taught.

Professor Ko's topics should be easy for non-geography people to digest. However, Professor Lam and Qian's topics may be a bit difficult and confusing to understand if it's your first time learning about that. Imao even for me, I was still confused about some of the content under Prof Lam's topics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
From the 3 professors, Prof Ko had the best teaching. Although she can come off as a bit strict, she explains very clearly and has summary checkpoints after key concepts.

Prof Lam is very kind and friendly. I think her teaching is ok, but not as clear as Prof Ko (or maybe it's just because Prof Lam's topics are more complicated).

Prof Qian is also a nice guy. But since I already knew most of the things in his topics, I didn't really pay attention to his teaching style.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two parts:

1. Assignment = 20%
[17/20, mean: 15.? / 20, high: 19/20]
2. Final = 80%
[57/70, mean: can't remember, high: 59/70]

However, they said would also take into account attendance. Not sure how serious they were about this though.

The final was all multiple choice question. If you attended all the lectures, you should be fine. I thought I did good in final, but somehow only got 57. Prof Ko doesn't allow answer checking, so don't know what I got wrong.

Ended up with A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was very light. Only had one assignment and a final.

For the assignment, we had to write a 500 word essay about an environmental topic of your choice. For those who took IB, this is like the long question in Paper 1. If last time your teacher made you write practice essays for those questions, you could even recycle one of those essays but just tweak a bit here and there. I wrote up mine a few hours before the deadline.

If you follow this basic structure, you should be fine:

1. Intro
2. Main Body (follow the PEE method (point, evidence, *explain)
3. Conclusion + final thoughts

*Most of the points for the essay will be given on the explain part where you are required to show critical thinking

During the course, if you are struggling with certain concepts, maybe it'll be better to read those chapters in the textbook or watch some youtube videos. Then to study for final, just watch the recorded lecture.

reviews.author: Prisca
reviews.title: Short Review
reviews.comment_content:
Course grading:

20% 500 words Essay
80% Final
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Qian taught the first two lessons. He had quite a strong accent, but overall his teaching was smooth and you can understand well. Only a small portion in the final exam.

Professor Ko and Lam taught most of the course. Make sure to go to both of their lessons. Or watch the lecture videos, because some of their questions will be found outside the lecture notes. Professor Lam is super nice and willing to answer questions. She would also provide some extra questions but not tested in the final.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got above mean in the essay and little below mean in the final.
Final grading was B-
I think it was ok. Usullay people said summer sem has a better grade...

I think if you join the lesson or watch back the lecture videos, you will be fine. If you want a higher grade, make sure to study earlier. The final consists of 70 MC within 60 minutes, I think it's a bit rush if you have to keep on searching your notes and the internet. So better to memorise everything and you will be fine. Ga yau!

reviews.author: Christine.D
reviews.title: Unexpected good grade!
reviews.comment_content:
Content:
A general picture of Environmental Science(Pressing issues & Global effort for dealing with environmental challenges)
Matter & Energy & Resources
Earth major biomes
Biodiversity and its threats
Food security and nutrition
Population and sustainability
Atmosphere and climate
Air pollution
Water Resources and Pollution.

I think the content is quite nice, but it depends on whether you are interested in this kind of topic. In my opinion, it's even a little bit easy since I have already learned most of them in high school geography and biology. However, the historic part is really really boring and complex.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Qian: Only taught the first two lectures for the first topic. Prof. Qian is quite prestigious in this field and lectures really well, but it's a little bit hard to catch up some time and needs preparation in advance.

Prof. Ice Ko: Good English. She likes asking questions and add more related content without recording to make sure students are attending lectures carefully.

Dr. Cindy Lam: Her content is the lasting thing to be memorized. If you understand the mechanism in different natural models, you may get the correct answers by logical analysis.
reviews.comment_grading:
A really surprisingly good grade. It is said not easy to get a good grade since A range is quite small and I didn't prepare really well (just go through the PPT once) but got A finally (unbelievable!).
short essay 20%: analyze an environmental event 15/20 (500 words)
final exam 80%: 57/70 (60 min)
reviews.comment_workload:
The content in the summer semester is much less than that in Fall or Spring, so it's much easier to remember most of them. Meanwhile, due to the online mode, the exam focuses more on understanding rather than memorizing, so students don't need to spend lots of time to memorize details.
Really recommend taking it now!

reviews.author: thyc0309_
reviews.title: Mediocre course
reviews.comment_content:

Ice Ko:

Haven't attended. Can't tell.

Ice Ko:
好唚氣, just like a mother who keeps nagging her children. But explain things in detail and quite clear.

20% 500-word essay on an environmental science issue of your choice

Me:

attachments.name: OCES-LIFS 1030 course outline (Summer 2019-20, as of 20 July 2020)

reviews.author: Midnite
reviews.title: Good for memorizing-lovers
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is the same as ILO and its quite interesting to learn about current environmental change in real life instead of those in the usual textbook. Though the content itself has a lot of statistical and charts data around the environment in China or HongKong, and we need to memorize some of the data regarding the charts for the exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is not necessary to come to the lecture as they always give out recording about the lecture. Qian's lecture is much more interactive and attractive rather than Cindy's, since she often just read from the ppt.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is only from the midterm and finals, they are all MCQs, and most of the questions are from past papers, that's why it's so hard to find past papers. Some of the questions are not in the ppt
reviews.comment_workload: There is no other assignments in this course other than the midterm and final test.

reviews.author: immature
reviews.comment_content:
The content is boring and is all about remembering useless details  on lecture ppt.
The examples are all HK-based, actually you can not learn much from this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof.Qian is an experienced professor and I can tell he has a deep understanding of the subject. He preferred to turn some of the lights in the lecture hall off, so his class makes me sleepy.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is terrible. the final exam is all about unimportant details of the lecture and even require two short answer problems that is more than 400words in total.(you only have 1h for the whole paper)
reviews.comment_workload: there is nothing required from the prof. but to fully remember the lecture materials ,it takes a lot of time.

reviews.author: Knowlton
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting content
Need to recite research on almost all course content and you are good a liberal studies

I personally took DSEexam
reviews.comment_teaching: I had Cindy Lam for my prof. I think the prof talks fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very fair

Due to special situation, final exam is conducted online where students like us can look at our books and lecture notes

There are also two 200 words short questions we need to answer within 60 minutes.
reviews.comment_workload:
As with many other courses, there is no such thing as "mandatory" homework or exercise practice.

But if you put in the effort to memorize the stuff from lecture slides, it will pay off in the exam and you will get a good grade.

Remember to leave adequate time to study and to plan ahead (study at least two weeks before the midterm or final exam)

reviews.author: gradeson
reviews.title: Fair course
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus:
Before mid-term :
Pressing issues
Global warming vs cooling
Other environmental issues
Human Population Dynamics & Population
Global effort for dealing with environmental challenges
Biodiversity and Its Threats
Life supporting systems
Earth's Major Ecosystems
Matter, Energy and Resources
After mid-term:
Food safety and security
Environmental Health
Environmental Toxicology
Greenhouse Gases
Pollutants and three classical problems in air
Water Supply, Usage and Cycle
Aquatic Hypoxia and Eutrophication Water Pollution and Remediation
Microplastics_Global and Local Impacts
Solid Waste Management

The content is quite interesting and useful in daily life
reviews.comment_teaching:
Before midterm, it is mainly taught by Prof Pei-Yuan Qian and Prof. Jin Sun
Prof Pei-Yuan Qian is a mainland prof with good knowledge of his profession but he is not good at teaching. Prof Pei-Yuan Qian has heavy mainland accent English and talks many things not related to the lecture and ppt slide. It is difficult to understand his teacher
His ppt slides are also not reader-friendly and hard to get the main point
The English of Prof. Jin Sun is better but he only follows the ppt slides to read and not explain the details
The lectures can be skipped if taught by them, it is a waste of time to attend their lesson
After mid-term, it is mainly taught by Dr. Cindy Lam.
Dr. Cindy Lam can explain the point clearly and she is a nice lecturer. However, you need to dot notes in her lesson since some questions in the final exam were come from her lecture but not in her ppt slide. If you want to get a high grade, you should not skip her lecture
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm : 50%(55/80 mean: 54/80)
Final: 50%(31/50 mean 31.89/50)
The content of the final exam only includes the topic after midterm, before midterm is exclude
Final grade: B-
Quite a fair grade
reviews.comment_workload:
very low, only midterm and the final exam.
But need to memorize many ppt slides before the exam.
If you are good at reciting, this course might be very suitable for you.

reviews.author: siyu93
reviews.comment_content:
By the end of this course, the students are expected to be able to

1)Comprehend essential environmental concepts such as life supporting system, biodiversity and biomes, natural resources, sustainability, and their inter-relationships

2)Develop a broad interest and connect the knowledge to their major study

3)Recognize the importance of harmony among human, the nature, and a sustainable living society

4)Apply the knowledge in daily life and contribute to environmental
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very Boring .They just simply read out the ppt slides.I always felt a sleep in their lectures.

However, they feel free to answer students' questions and explain deeply.

Cindy announced the lecture videos were available on Canvas during the special arrangement in this semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
Only midterm and final is required

Mid Term: 50%
Content: L1-12
Answer 80 MCs in around 75 minutes
Mean: 54
Max: 70
s.d. : 6.7

Final: 50%
Content: L14-24
This semester is online exam
Answer 34 MCs and 2 short question in 1 hour


Quite Broken grade
I get mean in midterm and slightly below mean in final exam.
Finally got a C+
Both exams need good time management to answer all the questions, especially this year final exam
reviews.comment_workload:
No Homework is required.Only need to prepare for two exams.
Each lecture ppt slides are so many that normally around 50 slides each lecture.
Just memorize all the slides if you want to get a good result in this course.

reviews.author: Mukul
reviews.title: Should Consider Taking
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting, although I am not very interested in Environmental Science the content was engaging.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is Very good. Cindy LAM, who teaches post Mid term is very good. she asks a lot of questions making the class very interactive and fun. the interest of the teachers in the subject makes it interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is simple. There is a mid term and one final exam

Mid term is MCQ questions

Final Exam is MCQ + a few short questions
reviews.comment_workload:
Work load is fine. As long as you show up to class regularly and pay attention you should not need to do much revising other then before mid term and final.

Incase of missed lectures catching up is not very hard as PPTs are well made.

reviews.author: MetalFusion
reviews.title: I am beginning to question my sanity after reading other reviews
reviews.comment_content:
Not sure if my review can actually help, as I skipped a lot of lectures. (To make studying this course easier you should make notes during lectures or make notes by yourself when you are free) Don't just make notes on the printed powerpoints though (as many people are doing this I have to say it), I believe it actually makes studying harder, you should organize the content in the lecture and make your own notes on Word or something. (Pictures are not that important but if it makes understanding the content easier, you should add it)

Very general knowledge on environmental science. If you don't understand, find someone with previous knowledge on ecology or geography to teach you.

Midterm 40%:
MCs
Don't remember every detail, just remember the equations and the concepts. Some questions are a bit tricky.

Final 60%:
Only Short Questions, try not to believe having MCs in the final as we didnt get any even though there should be.
Remember all the equations as they are very important and make sure you can explain the concepts before going to the exam, I don't think just memorizing would help you answer the questions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko:
If you don't have any previous background on ecology and geography, you should attend all the lectures. She tends to not post the full powerpoint on canvas and you would have to pay attention during the lecture and drop down notes. (some questions are from those missing parts) Don't even think about taking pictures of the missing slides as she wont allow it.
Please just follow every rules here so the lecture can actually run smoothly:
1. No taking pictures of slides
2. No talking
3. Be punctual or don't attend at all
4. Answer her questions actively (not a big deal but not answering her would waste a lot of time)

Wenxiong Wang:
Explains things very clearly, I like how he teaches but was too lazy to attend lectures so I can't give much opinion on him
The slides are pretty much empty, so attend the lectures if you want good grades.
reviews.comment_grading:
Its easy to get a good grade in my opinion, I probably didn't even attend half the the lectures as I only went to 2 lectures from Wang and occasionally(?) skipped Ko's, but since I have previous knowledge, you may not want to take my word for it.

Midterm: almost 1 sd above mean (missing 1-2 marks)
Final: almost 1 sd above mean (missing 1-2 marks)
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: Aside from attending lectures, theres nothing much going on.

reviews.author: sybai3125
reviews.comment_content: You will learn about basic stuff in biodiversity and atmosphere. It has no need in understanding but just memorization.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching was not boring but not fun too. It is still a lecture that you are able to listen and study.
reviews.comment_grading: GRADING is fair. If you have memorized well your grade will be high. It has a midterm, final exam and a video project with a group of minimum 4. I believe if the video shows that you have worked hard enough, the professor gives you a good score. Midterm and final exam is easy, but if you don't study hard enough it will be hard.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is not that heavy unless your group member doesn't work hard and you have to do all the video work. If you study daily, the midterm and the final exam won't take that long to study. However if you don't study daily, there'll be lots of work to do before the exams.

Heavy

reviews.author: wing123
reviews.title: interesting and quite good grade
reviews.comment_content: this course include knowledge about biology, chemistry and little geography. Although there are many things you need to memorize, it is interesting for those who love science.
reviews.comment_teaching:
you must attend ICE's lessons because she would teach some extra things that won't be mentioned in the ppt.

WANG's lessons is quite boring. I attended just two lessons and give up.
reviews.comment_grading:
mt above mean 2 marks.
final above mean one sd

reviews.author: Nicky Fung
reviews.title: Have Chem/ Bio background can try
reviews.comment_content:
Before Midterm
1. Energy, Matter, and Resources in the Environment
2. Earth's Major Biomes
3. Biodiversity and Its Threats
4. Human Populations and Ecological Footprint
5. Food Security and Nutrition

After Midterm
1. Atmosphere and Climate
2. Greenhouse Gases
3. Air Pollution
4. Water Resource and Cycle
5. Water Shortage, Eutrophication and Hypoxia
6. Water Pollution
7. Environmental Health
8. Environmental Toxicology
9. Biomonitoring

If you are interested in how the environment works and how it is correlated to us, this course is for you. Having a little chem/bio background will be a bonus as you can understand the ppts much easier.

The textbook is not necessary. I did not purchase the textbook and still worked.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ko is a very good lecturer. Though sometimes you may feel a bit stressed as she likes to ask questions, it is actually quite useful as the questions are critical and help us brainstorm the concepts.

Wang is also a very good lecturer. The ppts are well designed like adding a lot of pictures and graphs. He will also invite top-notched ecologist to give a talk in HKUST and the topic is interesting as well. However, his accent is really hard to follow and sometimes boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
My grades

Mid-term: 52/60
Mean: 42.6 / 60
SD = 7.1 / 60

Final: 89/100
Mean = 70.0 / 100
SD = 19.6 / 100

I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: No assignment across the whole semester.

reviews.author: Hmmm12345
reviews.comment_content:
It covers some content about geography, biology.
Highly suggest students who didn't study science subjects in secondary school not to take this course or you may find it extremely difficult to keep up.

PS. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. THE EXAMS WILL ONLY COVER THE CONTENT IN THE POWERPOINT!!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Qian is OK.
Ice Ko is good. Tho she doesn't allow anyone to use smartphones or taking pictures of the powerpoint. Plus some of the content she taught in the lessons is not included in the ppt. So, better not to skip her lessons.
Cindy is fair. Her Hongkong accent really gets on my nerve. It's still understandable.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is actually fair.
midterm 35%, 50 MCQs
final 65%, 50 MCQs and some long questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework at all.
There are 25 ppts in total, some are 30 sth pages and some are 50sth. It's literally pure memorization. If you are bad at memorization, don't take this course.

You should better recite every single word if you aim for A range. L

reviews.author: SST
reviews.title: Common Sense, 唔求A grade 都唔太需要背嘢
reviews.comment_content:
Easy course coz most of the contents are common sense, you could get high marks if you memorize all the ppt
The course consists of 7 parts
1: Our Environment and the Challenges(8 lectures)
-mainly about global climate changes, pollution problems, conventions(the most terrible part of the course for me, coz you'll have to memorize all of them if you aim high marks) and biodiversity
2: Matter and Energy(1 lecture)
-some easy and basic knowledge of physics, chemistry and biology
3: Life and Biomes(3 lectures)
-more about ecology and geography(easy for students who have studied geography before)
4: Human Populations(1 lecture)
5: Food and Nutrition(1  lecture)
6: Environmental Health and Toxicology(3 lectures)
7: Atmosphere and Pollution(2 lectures)
8: Water Resources and Pollution(3 lectures)
9: Solid and Hazardous Wastes(2 lectures)
reviews.comment_teaching:
QIAN's lectures are quite boring, I sometimes fall asleep. But he is willing to answer students' questions and share his experience.
KO only taught 2 lectures which is about biodiversity. She would teach something not included in the ppt but she does not allowed taking any photos of the ppt during the lectures(be punctual for her lectures). Interesting lectures.
LAM is a nice teacher. I like her lectures coz she talks quite lively. Extra information is also provided.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading.
Midterm(50%) 80 MC questions
Final(50%) 60 MC questions and 4 ten marks long questions
Midterm :Mean = 54.0, s.d. = 9.98 (total 80 marks)
Final :Mean = 57.0, s.d. = 13.6 (total 100 marks)
I got 49 in midterm(I did nearly no revision in the midterm) and 64 in the final, finally got a B-
reviews.comment_workload: Only midterm and final. No assignment. Very light workload.

reviews.author: ariesscy
reviews.comment_content: If you have studied about Geography, Biology, History, Physics and Chemistry. You may understand this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching of Qian is boring. He will talk a lot of things but you will not be able to catch his main point. His voice also dull and make you sleep.
Lam's teaching is slightly better as she will read the power point directly. You may need to jot down some notes as some slides may not be provided
reviews.comment_grading:
The Grading is fair.
Midterm: 42/80
Mean: 54
S.D : 9.98
Final : 59/100
Mean: 57
S.D : 13.6
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all as there are not homework or project

reviews.author: Bao
reviews.comment_content: General knowledge about environmental science, but it's still quite detailed. Like we all know that acid rain will influence the marine system and the organisms there. But you need to member the chemical name and formula for different types of substances. And also the name of several animals that will be influenced at different levels. I think it's too detailed and useless for people who without a science background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
KO is really responsible and strict. But her class has a really good atmosphere and she explained everything very clearly.
QIAN only taught one lesson. But his accent is a little bit difficult to understand.
LAM has detailed ppt. But she's classes are boring...
reviews.comment_grading:
Disappointed.
Midterm (30/35), mean 25, sd 5.6, high 33.6
Final (41/65), mean 36, sd 10.5, high 58
It's a ccc, it should have a better grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you just want a pass, then no workload.
But if you want a B or A, you need to be very very familiar with those slides, especially for LAM's lessons. (each lecture has about 60 slides)

reviews.author: Janice Chiu
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite easy, especially if you have taken chemistry or related science subjects in high school. It is an elementary course for environment science so the content are simple.
reviews.comment_teaching: understandable. Be honestly speaking it is not necessary as attendance is not counted. Also, the content are easy so you can self-study them at home. But for Ice KO's class, she will teach something that is not shown in the ppt, and those will appear in the exam. So I do recommend you to go to her class. But other than that, you can choose if you wanna attend the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term: above 1.5 sd
group project: mean
final: forgot... or maybe they did not post the mark?? not sure
I got a B+ at last. I am not so satisfied as I am expecting A range. Anyway I would say the grading is good.
reviews.comment_workload: Just one group project. you dun have to spend a lot of time on it as it is a group assignment. For mid term and final, only mc questions are tested. So you dun need to spend a lot of time for this course.

reviews.author: Jessie0302
reviews.comment_content: The content was simple and easy understanding by reading through the notes. People who are with geography and biology background would be advanced.
reviews.comment_teaching: Different teachers have different teaching style. They sometimes provided many pieces of information which are not related to the notes and exam. Quite boring.
reviews.comment_grading: My midterm was below one sd, the assignment and the final was fair. Still got a B, therefore i think the grading is quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: No participation is needed, so i think is okay for not attending the lesson. The midterm is just mc questions. The writing assignment is short and handed in in the end of the semester. However, the final included long questions which are the most difficult part of the course.

reviews.author: tschanag
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture Topics Include:
- Global environmental challenges (overview of current pressing issues around the world)
- Energy, matter and resource (basic knowledge especially for non-science background ppl)
- Earth Major Biomes (types, distributions, and characteristics of different biomes) (those who like geography might find this topic interesting)
- Biodiversity: significance and threats (with a little case study regarding giant panda)
- Nutrition and food supply (general concepts) (those who studied biology before might have advantage)
- Human Populations (some statistics just for you to understand, least content to memorize)
- Atmosphere and Climate (have to make sure you understand the phenomena like El Nino and La Nina)
- Air Pollution
- Water Resources and pollution
- Wastes and disposal (exams might test on some minor details)

Most of the content are common sense and the exam is only testing your memorizing ability. Dont take this cc when you are not required.
reviews.comment_teaching: Chinese professors' pronunciation are difficult, if not impossible, to comprehend. And they are just repeating the content on the powerpoints. I slept most of the classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite bad imo. I had 1.3sd above mean in the midterm and above mean in the exam(6x/100) and essay(16/20). Was expecting a B+.
Not only the grading is poor, but also the examining focus has shifted since this semester. There will be 5 short questions in the final and I was notified 2 weeks before the final. I would have dropped the class if I knew it earlier. Thus, I did the exam poorly in the final because I didnt recite the ppts.
In the past, there are only mc in both midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload: There's no assignment and no attendance have to be taken. So the workload is pretty low. The only thing needed to do is to finish a 4 hundred word essay which is very very easy.

reviews.author: S.A
reviews.comment_content: Largely monotonous, not at all engaging. Requires memorization of lots of obscure statistics. Have to attend all lectures of be willing to read the lecture notes and thoroughly understand the content of each slide. Lecture slides are exceptionally long.
reviews.comment_teaching: Attempted to engage students, but the content was prohibitive to this. Professor would go around engaging students in the back, although they were not paying attention, and had nothing to add.
reviews.comment_grading: If memorization is not an issue then a good course to take. Find a good group to do the project with, it’s just a simple video, not at all hard, although coming up with an interesting topic can be difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Content and workload is not hard at all, just exceptionally tedious.

reviews.author: lawwwww
reviews.title: LIFS1030
reviews.comment_content:
Include biology, chemistry, environment and many other things
Change the exam format suddenly in final exam
Midterm is all MC
One essay with 400 words need to be submitted
reviews.comment_teaching: Fine, taught by different professors
reviews.comment_grading:
all above mean, but only get C range
I expect the grade of basic course would be better
The grading is the worst among all the course I have taken
reviews.comment_workload:
final exam is difficult, as there are short questions\
For example, writing the ozone cycle in detail
Would be easy for science students, but not those without science background
p.m. I am a business student without any science background

reviews.author: Lynne
reviews.comment_content:
It is a mixture of Biology, Chemistry, Ecology, a bit of Physics and so on. There are a lot of case studies you should remember.

I think this class would be fun as long as you have huge interest in Life Sciences. Other than that, the class may be boring and requires you to memorise a lot. There is no lecture video, so if you wish, bring  your own recording.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ms. Ko Ice is an excellent teacher, but you should not use your phone to take photo of the lecture power points. You have to jot down extra information she provides.

Other teachers are okay; they mostly read the powerpoint.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good I think. I ended up with A

Midterm 39/50 with average 35.9 sd 5.7
Essay 16/20; no average or sd revealed
Final exam 82.5/100 with average 59.1 sd 13.5
reviews.comment_workload:
Light; only with final and midterm. There is an essay, but it is only around 400~440 words, so no big deal. You have to remember a lot of things in final because there are short-answer questions (about 60% of the marks actually.) If you did IB Biology option C (ecology) or IB Chemistry option Energetics, it will be easier for you to get good grades in class.

They do not check the attendance, so you can skip some of the classes (except for ICE KO's lessons)

reviews.author: Che92
reviews.title: Self-study memorization course
reviews.comment_content:
The teaching content and materials are quite general.

Pressing Global Environmental Issues
Global Warming and Cooling
Global Effort in Addressing Environmental Challenges
Life Supporting Systems
Hong Kong Environmental Issues
Matter and Energy & Energy Resources
Biodiversity and Its Threats
Nutrition and Food Supply
Environmental Toxicology and Health
Air Pollution
Water Pollution
Wastes and Disposal
reviews.comment_teaching:
All bad except Ice Ko, they cannot even finish the lecture notes, self-study is even better than attending lectures.

They had told you they change video project to an essay on add-drop period ONLY. And then they told you final exam will have "some" short questions in the mid-term period (or after the period? I can't remember.) Where are their responsibility?
reviews.comment_grading:
Not bad.
But they won't tell you anything about the essay, you have to guess the criteria to make a good "LIFS" essay.
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable workload.
A short essay (20%) 400 words
Mid-term (30%) all MC
Final exam (50%) including MC, Short questions, and draw picture

You should spend lots of time to remember everything on the lecture notes, including pictures and some stat.

reviews.author: delphine
reviews.title: Easy but a lot to memorize
reviews.comment_content:
the content of the course is easy to understand, most of them are just basic knowledge.
Quite boring
no need to take attendance
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Wai Ping will give some additional information on the lecture that is not written on ppt.
All the instructor's teaching is boring, they are basically reading the ppt, you can just read the ppt by yourself.
reviews.comment_grading: not very tight grading but it is hard to get a high mark as most ppl find it easy.
reviews.comment_workload:
only one essay,
midterm all MC
no extra reading required

reviews.author: twinkle
reviews.comment_content:
The content covers most of the topics in environmental science. However, most of the topics are introduced briefly so that it is hard to get a profound understanding of the concepts in the end. Also, although it is a science school foundation course, this course does not require any background knowledge in environmental science. All you need to get a good grade is reciting all the words on the lecture notes!
To be frank, the content is quite boring, extremely the case study part. The reason for this is that you don't need to analyze the cases by yourselves. They have been analyzed for you and then you have more lecture notes to remember : )
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice KO taught the first two lectures and three lectures immediately after midterm. There was always too much content in her powerpoint for her to finish. Also,  she deleted some important points in the lecture notes uploaded on the canvas so you need to concentrate in the lectures.
Prof Qian just read out his lecture notes. It is not necessary to go to the lectures since his lecture notes contains all the content in the exam.
Prof wang put many pictures without explanation in his powerpoint, but he usually failed to explain these pictures clearly in his lectures. Since the pictures will appear as short essay questions in the final exam, you'd better know about the pictures by searching on the Google.
Cindy LAM just taught the last two lectures. Like Ice ko, her lecture notes contain too much content for her to complete. Many unrelated or weird points will be asked in the final exam so you need to review the lecture notes carefully.
To sum up, none of the instructors teaches very well. Generally speaking, studying by yourself and searching anything you are unclear about are much better than going to the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is generally good. In fact, a majority of 400-student courses have a good grading.
Midterm: 50 multiple choices
mean 36/50 SD 5.7
Final: 34 multiple choices & 5 short essay questions
mean 59.1/100 SD 13.5
A short essay about 400 words, any topic about environmental science
mean 14.6/20
scheme: 20% short essay+30% midterm+50% final
overall 79.6% got A. I think the grading is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload: All you need to get a good grade is to remember all the words on the powerpoint. Just some workload before exams. Your grade is highly related to how much lecture notes you remember.

reviews.author: Dannn
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite interesting and if you have studied biology before, it will be easier for you as some topics are covered in high school biology already. However, there's still A LOT TO MEMORIZE!!!!
reviews.comment_teaching: I dont really go to lecture as it is sooooooo boring, I think Ice Ko is the only instructor that didnt make me fall asleep but she is very strict, even taking pictures of her slides is not allowed
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is quite good, I got B even though I expect worse
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm: All MC
However, They had changed the format of the final exam from all MC to MC+ short questions so you have more to memorize
And the short video assignment was changed to short essay this semester
not heavy for a 3 cred course

reviews.author: anthonyeric
reviews.title: 超級無敵究極大爆喪爛grade

Prof style 好唔同，要適應

冇Chem bkg 既busi 仔女最好迴避下

400 words essay
Mid term
Finals

reviews.author: wym
reviews.title: Involves a lot of memorization with a lot of content but fair grade
reviews.comment_content: The course is basically a mix of physics, chemistry and biology, spectrum ranging from energy, nutrition, air pollution to biodiversity. As a student with no science background at all, I was overwhelmed with the range of content covered and find it quite difficult to follow in class, as instructors teach as if you already understand the basic concepts. If you are just looking to fulfil a common core requirement, there are much better courses out there to choose from and you dont have to put yourself into this dire situation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturers in general were boring, I dont know if it's because of the content covered but I just found it uninteresting at all.

For Ice, you need to pay 100% attention and copy a lot of additional slides since she omitted some of the content from her powerpoint slides.

As for Wang, make sure you try to understand what he's trying to say because basically short questions are basically centred around his modules.

Copy a lot of notes for Cindy as well since she tends to elaborate a lot on each slide and provide a lot of additional information.
reviews.comment_grading:
You are graded on midterm exam, final exam and 20% on a 400-word essay of whatever life science topic you can think of. (Group project is changed to this essay)

For the essay the guideline is very unclear as to what they expect from you, like do they expect an academic essay or a business/argumentative essay? I went for a business essay and apparently they didnt like it lol

The format of the exam changed this semester, in the past it was all MC but in the final exam, 50 marks were on 'short' questions (really?!) and 50 marks on MCQ. The short questions were quite tedious to answer to be honest as it requires you to recite chemical equations and describe the different cycles in details, I mean if you didn't study you're screwed because there's absolutely no leeway for water blowing.

I scored B+ at the end with the two exams scoring above mean one SD  and essay below mean and the grading was much better than I expected.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light since there's only one essay due at the end of the semester, one midterm and one final.

reviews.author: Canicemts
reviews.comment_content: Global warming, biodiversity, water pollution, air pollution, human population...
reviews.comment_teaching:
prof Qian teaching is not very clear because of his ascent and the organization of the notes.
The only thing that is good about him is that he will tell you which part is  important  

Dr Lam speaks very slowly and quite soft but she is willing to answer your questions. However, you should do some research online to make sure that you understand the concept because she sometimes make mistake

Ice Ko is the best lecturer of this course. You can easily follow her and the notes are very clear. You must attend her lecture in order to get the full version of her notes
reviews.comment_grading: The grading will be good as long as you are willing to memorize the detail
reviews.comment_workload: this maybe the last semester that requires you the make a video. Without this you will be less stressed
