reviews.author: Tommy Leung
reviews.title: Good grade CC
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces students to the general concepts of environment, natural resources, and sustainable development. The topics include pressing global, regional and local environmental changes; life-supporting systems of our planet; biodiversity and its conservation; the atmosphere, water resources, and their pollutions; solid and hazardous waste management; environmental health and sustainable development. Throughout the course, students will gain a sufficient background and a better understanding of the root-causes of the upfront environmental issues. They will also become more aware of their role, as citizens, in environmental protection and sustainable development.
reviews.comment_teaching: You cannot 100% rely on professor's teaching especially you are not a science student. It takes time to fully understand some important topics like the mechanism of El-Nino or carbon cycle.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading of LIFS 1030 is good, most people can get a B range easily.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework in this LIFS1030 and the only workload is a five-people group project. Students need to make a five minutes video on a related topic like air pollution, solid waste problem or energy crisis. It was graded a C because the video project consumes a lot of time and too many preparation works are needed. Especially for LIFS 1030 in the summer semester, you have only around one month of time to produce it.

reviews.author: legendary5b
reviews.title: The lecture is somewhat boring but the task is not
reviews.comment_content:
This course gives an overall picture of environmental science and it almost over all the subjects under this topic.

But general usually means every subject is very rough.

And you have to recite a lot of knowledge to handle the exams.

By the way, the topics of the two exams do not overlap.
reviews.comment_teaching:
QIAN, Peiyuan: He only taught us one lecture so I'm not sure.

KO, Ice Wai Ping: every subject she taught was clearly elaborated. But she is strict and treated the students as senior high school students.

LAM, Ka Sin Cindy:  She is very nice but I have to be honest that she didn't explain things well. And her lectures confuse me and bore me.
reviews.comment_grading: The overall grade is very well but the speed of TA marking the project and exams is very slow.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy since you don't have to do any assignment through the course. But you have to make a 5 min video. YOU HAVE TO VERY CREATIVE! Else you can't get a good grade in this course.

reviews.author: Emilyleung54
reviews.comment_content: not so much, not that difficult either.
reviews.comment_teaching:
kinda waste of time, but takes attendance. So, better not skip any lessons.
In the lessons, theres mainly discussions, MANY discussions.
there'll be bonus points as well if you answer the questions asked by the instructors.
reviews.comment_grading:
pretty shit, not gonna lie.
Studied for one night, got C
reviews.comment_workload:
Not so much either.
One midterm, one final, as expected.
theres also an essay by the end of the whole semester. the essay requires 400words. there'll be a few topics for students to choose.

reviews.author: Reneqinn
reviews.title: good contend, average teaching
reviews.comment_content: The contents are about general concepts of environment, natural resources, and sustainable development. The topics include pressing global, regional and local environmental changes; life-supporting systems of our planet; biodiversity and its conservation; atmosphere, water resources, and their pollutions; solid and hazardous waste management; environmental health and sustainable development.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ice is a wise instructor and put things very clear. Cindy's English is the biggest problem, which is hard to understand very often. Qian only gave one lecture but I can tell he is very knowledge and logical.
reviews.comment_grading: Average. Not so good yet not so bad.
reviews.comment_workload: This course is made up of 2 parts. A video and two exams. The exam questions are quite tricky, which is hard to get right. It requires a lot of memorable details. The video is fun to work on. In addition, the video evaluation is also a good chance for me to learn from others.

reviews.author: IvanZhanggg
reviews.title: huge amount of contents, bad grade.
reviews.comment_content: Like most introduction course especially S&T common core, the content is informative and only focus on some basic knowledge of the environmental science topics. Some topics are cancelled during the summer term, though there are still huge amount of slides to remember. If you attend lectures or at least look through the slides frequently, it will not be too hurry before exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice KO is one of the best lecturers I have ever met in UST. She is relatively strict with students, so you should not play video games on your phone or chat with friends during the class(which should be basic requirements for college students).  Special attention should be paid that she is used to providing some extra contents during the lectures, so make sure you attend the classes on time or remember to copy your reliable friends' notes.
I am not sure whether Cindy is familiar with her content since she frequently loses her minds while teaching and finally turns around to read aloud the slides. Unlike Ice is capable to write clear as well as short slides, Cindy's material is not structured and is full of charts and explanations. It is quite an excruciating work when reviewing her slides. So good luck to her part.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm and final are closed book tests, requiring you to remember the basic concepts and some examples mentioned while teaching.
Grading scheme is quite tight.Got mean+1 sd in midterm and final, finally B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Two exams and one project. To be honest, the workload depends on your project mates. Luckily, you could form groups by yourself.
You have around three to four weeks to finish a five-minute video clip. You do not need to shoot all the content by yourself. Sources from Youtube is acceptable as long as acknowledged.
Since this semester, you only need to rate and write comments for 10 videos from you peers. Even if you start this job after final, you still have 4 days to finish it.
Lots of things to remember before exams if you do not attend lectures like me LoL

reviews.author: Minerva
reviews.comment_content:
- Pressing Global Environmental Issues
- Global Warming and Cooling
- Global Effort in Addressing Environmental Challenges
- Life Supporting Systems
- Hong Kong Environmental Issues
- Matter and Energy & Energy Resources
- Biodiversity and Its Threats
- Nutrition and Food Supply
- Environmental Toxicology and Health
- Air Pollution
- Water Pollution
- Wastes and Disposal

etc.

All about the environment. Required to memorize many things.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Qian & Prof. Wang - Super boring. No need to go to class.
Dr. Ko & Dr. Lam - Good. Worth to go to class. Some exam questions are related to what they emphasized during the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 25% (mean: 37.4 out of 50, sd: 6.9)
Final 45% (mean: 47 out of 80, sd: 10.1)
Group Project 30% (mean: 24.6 out of 30) - inc. peer evaluation

I got above 1 sd for midterm, above 1.5 sd for final, and 26.9/30 for the project. Finally, I got A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Spend some time studying for the exams. The mean is quite low, so it is easy to get a good grade.
Spend more time doing the project. Don't procrastinate. Also, there is an intra-group peer evaluation, so don't be a free rider if you want a good grade.

reviews.author: Jaeyoung
reviews.comment_content: For those of you who are not sure what environmental science is, it is a weird mixture of biology, chemistry and geography. There are a lot of things you learn but some of them you can just figure out with your common senses without even studying it properly. And i felt that this course isn't that much about science despite its name.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite poor. The professors each teach different sections of the courses, but I and my friends soon figured out that most of the lectures are not worth going to. Even if you go to the lectures, you'll see 1/3 of students sleeping and the rest doing something else or procrastinating.

you can still get a fine grade by studying the lecture notes only even if you don't go to the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term exam, Final exam and a video project.

I did just about mean on all of the 3 assessments and got B.

Based on my experience, it is really hard to get an excellent grade on this course but getting a B is quite easy compared to other science courses.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much work to do.
Make sure that you get good teammates for your video project.

The two exams are all in multiple choice questions.
The important thing here is that quite a lot of questions, you can just solve using common senses. So how well you do in exam kida depends on how much basic scientific knowledge you have and whether your thinking skills are logical enough to figure out the right answer even if you didn't study. (I know,)

But make sure not to trust your brain too much. Some professors really give us some mean questions about really small details in ppt that nobody paid their attention too.
MAKE SURE THAT YOU DO STUDY UNLESS YOU WANT A SHITTY GRADE
(concentrate on small details on the powerpoint slides)

reviews.author: Leung
reviews.comment_content: Environmental issues (e.g. climate change, sewage treatment in Hong Kong, water & air pollution, toxic ...)
reviews.comment_teaching:
QIAN taught the first few lectures about global warming, his tone was quite boring but the content was good (he taught some evidence that supported global cooling which was not popular now)

ICE was a very good lecturer, she was well prepared for the lecture and her attitude was very great, she asked questions frequently, I suggest that you must attend her lectures, you can learn a lot from her.

Cindy and Wang's lectures were quite boring, but they always emphasize the key points, if you want to get some tips in revision, you should attend their lectures.They both very nice, questions related to the lecture are welcome.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm above ~1sd
Final above > 1.5 sd,
Video got a mean
The final grade is A which is quite good
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm and Final: 50MC and 80MC
The midterm was quite easy and the mean was very high, but the final was more difficult. If you, unfortunately, get a low mark in the midterm, try to work harder in the final and you may get a good final result.

Video: you can form your own group, the marks won't vary a lot, just enjoy it

reviews.author: CoralChen

Difficult to divide the labor

The first part mainly talks about the Global environment issues, just like global warming etc. And then it talks about the way that different government to solve the issues.

reviews.author: DEANOP
reviews.title: BADBADBADBAD
reviews.comment_content:
The content is interesting overall. well at least for me.
ppt slides with a lot of text.
ice's lecture must attend, because
reviews.comment_teaching: Ice is good at teaching but others are just awful
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not strict. I have to say.
I am on average on both mid term and final and badly on group project.
Got B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
A group project easy to do it as long as you find your trustworthy teammates.
The video project requires students to form a group of 5, producing a 5-mins video about any topic in Environmental Science. There will be a workshop teaching the students how to use Adobe Premiere Pro. Students can borrow equipments from the library for video production (Camera, video recorder, etc.) after joining the workshop. The workshop is quite useful. Common topics of the video project includes food waste, waste treatment and pollution problems. The project will be graded in terms of organization, critical thinking, creativity & teamwork.

reviews.author: AhWai
reviews.title: 中伏
reviews.comment_content:
廿幾個ppt，有唔同chapters e.g. Air, Biodiversity, Earth's Major Ecosystem, Energy, Food, Health, HK Environment...有啲ppt就得20-30幾頁，有啲又80-100頁

其實都多嘢背，有啲數據佢考試都會出，但唔多; 同埋我覺得背晒佢啲PPT都唔代表你考試會識，佢主要都係考你common sense
reviews.comment_teaching:
4個輪住教，但唔平均，有個好似教得一堂

利申:淨係上過一堂XD

嗰堂係Qian Peiyuan教，我覺得佢教得幾好，唔係照PPT讀，都幾生動，有PPT以外嘅嘢可以抄低

p.s. 我記得有個女(好似係KO)嘅把聲好難頂，仲要成日好強調cheating係好嚴重，煩死，又係final嗰陣好嬲咁叫啲人上前，淨係坐前面嘅20行，搞左勁耐。佢仲勁嚴囉!!!見到有人已經擺左電話係凳下面，但螢幕係面，嗰女人就經過見到，就叫佢擰番轉個電話@@我未坐之前，我張枱就歪左啲，佢經過嗰陣，冇出過聲就已經雙手推我張枱，當場嚇一嚇囉，考緊試架嘛!!!!填緊mc question paper!!!!拜託
reviews.comment_grading: 計分嘅全部都同mean差唔多/高過mean，但overall 得b- !!!!!!! 咩料!!!! 說好的好grade呢=.=
reviews.comment_workload:
Course assessment:
1. Course Activities (30%)
- Group project with Intra-group peer evaluation (25%)
- Inter-group peer evaluation (5%)

2. Examinations (70%)
- Midterm (25%)
- Final (45%)

Group project就係要自己form group(ard 5個)，再定主題，自己再拍5分鐘嘅片，其實算輕鬆，同埋佢都有啲video tutorial，比上年嘅sample你睇，仲講下有咩要求，好似好講求創意。最麻煩就係除左評自己友，又要評多十組嘅片=.=唔交就冇左啲分

Midterm就輕鬆嘅，唔太難，所以大家都算高分。50分滿分，mean: 37.4, high: 48

final淨係考midterm之後嘅chapters，但都有十幾個ppt，今次就難左，個mean都唔高 (48/80)，同埋真係唔多考ppt嘢

reviews.author: khloelee
reviews.comment_content: There are a lot of contents in this class. I personally did not like this class since there are too many things to memorize without any deep understanding about the content.
reviews.comment_teaching: In general, female professors' classes are good but it is hard to understand the pronunciation for the male professors' classes.
reviews.comment_grading: I guess grading is fair. If you go over every single slide, you will be okay. However, there are some questions that you did not learn and you need to infer so there are some questions that you cannot study. And, project (video making) is a very important part of the whole grade, so you need to work hard on the project.
reviews.comment_workload: There are a lot of things to memorize, so when it comes to the exam period, you will experience a huge amount of stress.

reviews.author: huxing
reviews.comment_content: This course covers a LOT of ground, and for me, a big part of them is not very interesting, but I bet some would find it more engaging. Also, since this course is given by multiple instructors, I think the course isn't thought out as a whole from the very beginning, and it shows in the course material. Exam covers literally everything covered, including the specific location of a waste processing plant in Hong Kong and the exact date of some conference decades ago. Depending on who you are, the content would range from horrendously boring to very informative.
reviews.comment_teaching: Personally I skipped most lectures, so I don't have much to say about teaching. If you have the determination to spend a few days going over all the slides prior to mid-term and final, skipping all the lectures is definitely doable.
reviews.comment_grading: Finish every task you are assigned, plan ahead, and meticulously your group video, get input from professors, BE READY FOR YOUR   EXAMS, you should be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically, the couple of days before the exams and couple of weeks of spare time devoted to group project is all you need. Plan ahead, or it will be hectic. (Deadline of group video is not that far from finals.)

reviews.author: mcyan
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is quite board including some environmental issues, biodiversity, population and etc.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good, about mean with half to one sd in the midterm and final exam would likely to get an A in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload of this course is fair, just midterm, final and project. Midterm and final are multiple choice which is easy to handle.   
Project is a 5-min video clip and you can choose any topic that is related to environmental science. It is suggested that to find a few of reliable friends to form a group.

reviews.author: chik
reviews.comment_content:
The content was rather broad, allowing us to learn a rather wide scope of knowledge. The course was split into four different sections; in which each section had its own specific kind of topic, e.g. Biodiversity, Urban Problems, Global Warming and Energy.
We got to know a lot of technical terms, theories, reasons and impacts of all these issues.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As the course was "split into" four different sections, there were different professors coming in; sometimes there were videos etc.
Different professors had different styles, totally different styles. But we could tell that each professor is highly knowledgeable in the field / section that he / she is specialized in. You could see the passion and also the knowledge that they possess.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade was fine; but as it was all-MC for both the midterm and for the final examination, the grades could vary from point to point. It is important to get ready for the midterms and finals to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is rather low as there is only a mid-term, finals (all MC) and also a group video.

reviews.author: qorhvk
reviews.comment_content: Personally, I do not like environmental science, so I cannot comment on the content. Science part is, if you are majoring in science or have some basic knowledge, super easy. O3, CO2, ozone, global warming those kind of stuff, really basic. But it might take some time to make yourself familiar with those terms if you are not science major. What I do not like was everything else came after the science part.  Bunch of statistics, memorizing stuff, where the conference was held and bla bla. It's just stuff that you need to memorize. I don't see the point of memorize percentages, but they do come up on the exam so.....
reviews.comment_teaching:
I wanted to give D but Ice KO was really good at teaching, so gave C.

Ice KO
Her voice is really clear, easy to understan. I suggest attend her lecture as she post slides that are not on the Canvas. She is really sensitive students using phones in the lecture and she really do humiliate the student in front of 400 people, so just be careful of that.

Cindy
Ohhhhh... her lecture was sooooooo boring but you need to go to the class as she emphasizes some things that will come up in the exam. I thought her part was evil becuase she throws lots of statistics questions at the final exam.

QIAN
his lecture was okay. Not hard to understand but he likes to turn the light off during the lecture so quite a lot of people doze off in last 30min.

Wang
Boring. Lecture slides are enough for revising
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade boosting course. I do not think my grade was outstanding, both mid term and final, but I got grades way better than I expected. I suppose A grade range is very broad.

I forgot the exact percentage of each section;
midterm 30
group assignment (video) 30
final  40

I think the percentage was around this. You can see from the above the group assignment is very important. Finals and midterms are not super hard, just see how much you remember from the lecture.
reviews.comment_workload:
They give enough time for group assingment. It is to make a five minute video about anything related to environmental issues. Form groups with nice people, have some fun making the video. Actually the video filming part was the most interesting one for me in this course.

Midterms and finals, just review the slides properly.

reviews.author: Allenwlchen
reviews.comment_content: the content of the course is kind of separated and the contents are sometimes not shown on the slides so the past paper is very important when it comes to preparing for the test, apart from that, they might include something sounds extremely complicated without even explaining it, so it is very important to let go some of the less meaningful parts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. QIAN was very nice and his way of teaching is more organized, others are fine, but some of their accents really take time to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: I personally think the grading is fair, but the peer evaluation counts a lot, even the quality of it is related to the grading of yourself.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is super low, and the past paper is very helpful for exams.

reviews.author: Aurora
reviews.comment_content: A combination of geography, biology, chemistry, history.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not very attractive.
reviews.comment_grading:
It depends on how much ppt you can memorize. Most  of answers to the exam questions  can be found on ppt. There were some really detailed questions about a certain meeting or the content of a graph . If you are good at memorizing and very careful, you can get a good grade.
MY GRADE: midterm: mean
                     final: over ten points higher than mean
                     video: 20 out of 30
                    total:B+
reviews.comment_workload: No assignment, no attendence. A five minutes video. But too much ppts and too detailed  questions were asked in exams. Need around three to four days to go through the notes.

reviews.author: Cat
reviews.comment_content: The content was quite rich but quite a number of memorization was needed, for example you need to know what kind of rubbish takes up the greatest proportion of municipal solid waste.
reviews.comment_teaching:
One professor is particularly boring...nearly fell asleep
But others were okay
reviews.comment_grading:
I got above one SD in mid term
Final above 0.? SD
project 21/30

I got B

I think final is quite important
reviews.comment_workload:
One mid term
One Final
One project-you need to make a video about any environmental issue that you like
The quality of video is essential too, alongside the ethics, creativity...

If you are going to make a better one, then the workload would be a bit big la as there may be many NG~

reviews.author: jkim1022
reviews.comment_content: The content was straightforward. There were relatively a lot to memorize. You have to attend the lectures because the professor gives hints about which questions come up on the exams
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was ok. However, at times it was hard to focus because the professor's voice was monotone.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was good. If you memorize the slides on the powerpoint and take notes during the lectures, it would be easy to get a good mark. There is one video to complete with a group, a mid- term exam, and a final exam. The mid- term and final were all multiple choice, but some of the questions were quite confusing.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was not that much. I would recommend to finish the video quickly and get it out of the way.

reviews.author: Tuna
reviews.comment_content: It is not a hard course as i have studied biology and geography in HKDSE. It's like a summary of these two subjects. If you have studied the two subjects before, the content being covered is really simple. You don't have to worry about it, unless you just study the basis in these two subjects. You need to study the extension part in the two DSE subject in order to understand the course material thoroughly.
reviews.comment_teaching: I highly appreciated Dr. Ko and Prof. Qian. They will try to explain each concept in detail. Though the number of powerpoint pages of Prof. Qian is really numerous, it's not hard to understand if you have attend the lectures. Yet, for Dr. Lam and Prof. Wang, they are really poor when comparing with Dr. Ko and Prof. Qian. You cannot get any point even you attend the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is quite good. If you did well in the assessments, it's not hard to get an A range. And it's indeed on an individual basis. Though there is a group project, there is an evaluation system on the group mates, it is quite useful as they really change the score for free-riders a lot.

Above 1.5 sd for midterm and 1 sd in final, around 25 marks for project which is above mean a bit
--> final letter grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: The course has a mid-term, final exam and a group project. The formal for mid-term and final exam is just MCs. And you do not need to present for the final project so the workload is not that heavy. The hardest things is you need to write a evaluation for other groups' video. You are required to watch 20 videos in a week time, it takes quite a lot of time but without other workload, it is quite good.

reviews.author: wmsbm
reviews.comment_content: The syllabus includes a wide range of topics which are interesting and fundamental. Instructors use a lot of daily examples such as news and video clips to enrich the lecture content and deepen students' understanding. For a 2.5hour lecture in summer semester, the time passes fast especially in Ice Ko's lecture. You can earn a lot of common sense through this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ice Ko prepared well for her lecture but she always overrun. Cindy seems like not being familiar with her ppt and simply read out the slides as well as playing a lot of videos. Sometimes students ask questions but she is not able to answer. QIAN throws a lot of complicated concepts within short time that is hard to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
ALL MC Midterm 25%
ALL MC Final 40%
Video Project 35%

The midterm is more or less the same as the past paper found in internet and the final exam is quite tricky. The mean is not high so it is quite easy to get above mean.
reviews.comment_workload: The project is not challenging as you just simply add graphs and video clips to produce a 5-min video. They dont expect too much for the video as long as the content makes sense. If you pay attention during class, it is easy to get high scores in exams because some of them are not included in ppt notes. As the content is just basic introduction of some ideas, it is relatively easy to memorise as there are no long words or difficult concepts.

reviews.author: Casssuper6
reviews.title: Ice KO made me engaged in environmental science
reviews.comment_content: same as other posts
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko taught really well and made be curious about the lecture content. Her English is good and easy to understand. Make sure u attend the lecture on time as she keeps revising the most important takeaways from last lecture and it really refresh ur memeory

Cindy is OK too but a little bit boring.
reviews.comment_grading: quite linean coz I got below mean ard 1 SD for both midterm and exam but still got C
reviews.comment_workload: 2 quizzes only, not heavy but need time to digest the contents

reviews.author: notverysmart
reviews.title: not that bad
reviews.comment_content:
biology+chemistry+a little bit of geography (meteorology)

Prof. QIAN's part will focus on meteorology
Prof. Ko's part will focus on biology
Prof Lam's part will focus on chemistry

Content is insanely boring but Prof Ko tries her best to make her part as interesting as possible. Somehow everybody in this site hates her but honestly, there are worse professors lol.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching could be better. Better take this course when the university is in an online mode of teaching because I cant understand **** due to some professor's accent. Just watch the lecture videos before the exams and you will be fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Short Essay: 17/20 (mean 15.6) High is 19 if I'm not mistaken
Final Exam: 52/70 (mean 43, sd 9.3). High is 59 if im not mistaken.

Grade: A

I know someone that got 17 in the essay and 51 in the final. His final grade is A-. So I guess the grade cutoff for the A ranges are pretty close.

Final exam format is 70MCQs in 60 mins. Open notes, but you need to know where to look. Just make sure to get enough sleep and eat a decent breakfast before the exam. Maybe eat eggs so your brain works okay.
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload. One final and one 500 word essay. Basically any topic about the environment which is pretty ambiguous. I doubt the essay is read thoroughly due to the sheer amount of students in our class (500), so just make sure to pick an okay topic and use lots of pictures to give the impression that you are trying your best.

Since it is a morning class, I always AFK and later on 5 days before exam I finish all lecvids through canvas. Not a recommended strategy but I must say its possible to be a complete moron and still earn a decent grade.

reviews.author: Bambibibi
reviews.title: Not that bad. Interesting content and good teaching :)
reviews.comment_content:
The content is interesting and I enjoy taking this course. Instead of life sciences, I think it is more like a geography and liberal studies course. Tbh some of the concepts are just junior form geography. Not much to memorize cuz the exam is open book. Some of the concepts are similar to DSE Liberal Studies too.
I find the exam quite easy. You just have to attend all the lectures and study hard. Some of the questions are quite tricky. Pay attention to the wordings and logic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko:
People say Ice Ko is bad... but I think her teaching is great  XDXD Is that my problem? She delivers the concepts clearly and she emphasizes critical thinking. Her ppt are clear and easy to read. For her part, you dont have much to memorize.. just attend the lectures and remember what she says.

Cindy Lam:
I don't like her teaching. Sometimes she seems to be unsure of what she is talking about lolll... but remember to jot down what she says. She often asks students some questions during lessons and I saw similar questions in the exam.  

Qian Peiyuan:
He only gave 2 lectures so I dont have much to comment... But as I rmb his teaching is boring
reviews.comment_grading:
Not that bad actually
Short Essay: 17/20 (mean 15.6)
Final Exam: 51/70 (mean 43, sd 9.3)
Grade: A-
Not that bad... I thought I will end up with B+ but I got an A- at last. As long as you study hard I think getting at least B range is not hard.
reviews.comment_workload:
Average.... hahaha
I took this course during summer semester so the midterm is cancelled.
Have to submit a short essay around one week before the exam, just 500 words
Just one final exam

reviews.author: miclee
reviews.title: Good Course
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus cover ocean science and life science.
Students with geography basis are advantaged
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice was good at teaching and explaining.
Must attend Ice's lecture as there are lecture slides that cannot be found on canvas.

Cannot memorise how is Qian's teaching.

Cindy is basically a good lecturer but her teaching tone is kind of boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good Grading: Mid-term below mean for few marks
Final higher than mean for 4 marks
Final grade: C+
reviews.comment_workload: For students for do not want any assignment and projects, this course is a great course for you guys to study.

reviews.author: Someone123
reviews.comment_content: Areas mainly covered scientific principle of atmosphere, hydrosphere, global warming, solid waste problem, toxicology, over-population issue. All are simple concept, not too hard to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Qian and Wang have some accent, it might be a little bit difficult to listen.
reviews.comment_grading: Great. But something has changed in this year. The format of final exam has changed: MC (~30q) + Short essay (5q).
reviews.comment_workload: Not too heavy workload. Just a short essay (around 400 words) about any environmental issue you would like to talk about. It occupied 20%. And, it should be handed in at the end of the course. And then, there are 1 mid term (30%) and 1 final exam (50%).

reviews.author: Haakhtar
reviews.comment_content: Mainly basics about environmental conditions and how we are affecting them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures were quite boring. Did not attend many but still managed to understand information from lecture slides.
reviews.comment_grading: Easy A as long as you read the slides and do well in the video required. Exams do not need much studying. reading slides once will suffice. Exams are all mcq and some answers are quite obvious if you read the lecture slides
reviews.comment_workload: Minimal workload, the only real workload being the video. Group work seems to be the main problem if you get stuck with free riders

reviews.author: TomC00
reviews.comment_content: 有不同的環境issue，基本上有少少似中學的science/environment方面的堂咁，加上少少難d但又唔洗識得好深入既physics同地理，MC識揀就OK。如果讀LIFS1030，最好唔好讀埋PHYS1003，可能會覺得無咩用。
reviews.comment_teaching: Ice KO D notes就好鍾意留空，迫你上堂同聽書，但其實你如果連Ice KO都唔聽，基本上你可以唔洗上堂，因為Cindy同QIAN講到你唔想聽/訓左。
reviews.comment_grading: 好Grade既。Midterm,fianl全MC,，而且有好多時間做。亦有Pastpaper可以上網搵。video雖然高mean少少，但最後都好grade，所以你英文能力都唔洗話好勁先有好grade(但條片可能會高分d)，評論基本上認真寫應該ok，唔洗好似d人咁寫成萬字。
reviews.comment_workload: 以summer黎講都幾多野做,得一個星期左右既時間拍一條5分鐘既片(由0開始)。拍完又要o係一星期左右要睇半班人的video(我個時24組),寫唔限字數但計10%分既評論。但midterm,final都唔太難，全MC，係上面個2個星期會辛苦D，如果你fall/spring報應該好輕鬆。

reviews.author: Wong
reviews.comment_content: I skipped almost all the lessons except the lesson taught by Ice KO. The content of her video could be the questions in exam. She taught some current issues about global environment which is quite useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: As the content mentioned, I only attended Ice KO's lessons. No mobile phone, computer is allowed in the lessons. And, she walked around sometimes to ask students questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Too bad. The good grade concept is no longer existed anymore.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too heavy. Only one project is needed to submit. The topic of the project is

reviews.author: GalaxyGalaxy
reviews.title: GOOD!!
reviews.comment_content:
Topics include environmental problem and basic bio concepts.
The content are rather interesting, providing some fundamental knowledge about the earth and also the problem we are facing right now.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice ko is crazy but her teaching is good. There are around 40 TAs during the midterm LOL

Cindy is nice,
The other two are very boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good. I got A-, above mean around 1 sd during both midterm and final. i am not sure about the group project, but it was totally a disaster.
30% midterm
30% exam
30% group project
10% evaluation
You could find source for the midterm.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy. One midterm, one exam and one group project.
No need to go to class, no attendance is taken, just study the ppt.

reviews.author: Kevin
reviews.comment_content: It was a nightmare. The course has many overlapping content. Waste management was clearly an overlapping topic over all instructors lecture slides. Contents have been repetitive which demonstrates poor coordination and liaison of such course. Only the 1/3 of the course is of clear structuring, remaining are clearly of chaos.
reviews.comment_teaching: Majority of the instructors do not have good presentation skills. Worse off is some couldn't deliver contents without hesitations or in fluent English. Organization and timing of lectures may be an apparent problem as the instructors usually found problems to cover the pre-designated content under the planned timeline. Teaching are generally below average when comparing to other Common Core courses.
reviews.comment_grading: I was quite surprised by the grading to be honest. Although LIFS 1030 was crowned as one of the best-grading CC courses by words of mouth, it was not exactly true in my case. I was below mean for around 0.2SD for my mid-term, above mean for 0.6 to 0.7 SD for my final and just at mean for the project, I received a C+ for the course letter grade. I am not very sure whether we can call it as fair grading, but it appears majority of the CCs have the same grading distribution either.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite fair I would say. You only have to do 1 project throughout the entire 3 credits course. Make sure you get the right teammates. It doesn't happen in my case but there's once a student  who asked for help from the instructor as he faced 4 free-riders in a 5 members group. So team members are really crucial.

reviews.author: kelcins
reviews.title: LIFS 1030 Environmental Science
reviews.comment_content:
Learning Outcomes:
By the end of this course, the students are expected to be able to 1) Comprehend essential environmental concepts such as life supporting system, biodiversity and biomes, natural resources, sustainability, and their inter-relationships,
2) Develop a broad interest and connect the knowledge to their major study,  
3) Recognize the importance of harmony among human, the nature, and a sustainable living society,
4) Apply the knowledge in daily life and contribute to environmental protection.

Lecture Outline:
Energy, Matter and Resources in the Environment
Earth’s Major Biomes
Biodiversity: Its Significance and Threats
Nutrition and Food Supply  
Human Population Dynamics
Overpopulation and Population Control
Environment and Human Health
Environmental Toxicology
Atmospheric Circulation and Climate
Global Climate Change
Acid Rain and Ocean Acidification
Air Pollution
Water Resources and Usage
Water Conservation and Pollution
Wastewater Treatment; Eutrophication
Microplastics: Global and Local Impacts
Solid Waste and Waste Disposal


PS :
I hereby strongly recommend all of you attend the lecture on time. Students should join in the online lectures under their corresponding section and actively participate in the class interactions. Examinations will cover all lecture contents (not only the PPT contents).   

Therefore, If you intend to get good grades, please study hard and well.
reviews.comment_teaching:
the teaching is good. With clear explanations and illustrations, we can understand the course more.

Course Format :
Two lectures per week.
reviews.comment_grading:
So far So good. The grading curve is fair.

Course Assessment:
Midterm Examination (about 35%)  
Final Examination (about 65%)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. We do not need to hand in any homework. But Please remember study the course note well. If you fail to memorise all of them, you might easily fail the exam and mid-term exam because it requires we study the note throughly.

reviews.author: 數學研究生
reviews.title: 努力與成績不成正比
reviews.comment_content:
The content includes those basic things about environmental science, actually not basic to students did not study biology or geography before.

There are lots of pictures but insufficient explanations to those concepts and ideas. You'd better to attend lectures as the visualized powerpoint is not the same in canvas.
reviews.comment_teaching: See others comments.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very very bad grade, half for midterm exam and half for the final exam.

There are total 60 questions in the midterm exam, all of them are multiple choice questions with 5 choices in each question (A,B,C,D,E). Read the questions carefully, there are lots of tricks and traps for each single question, and do faster.

For the final exam, most of them are short essay questions, you have to write in paragraphs and answer the main points. Sometimes, you have to draw some pictures or figures to explain the ideas, better to remember those graphs. And there are some calculation questions, remember to bring your calculator and remember the formula.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy although there isn't any assignment. Time consumed in preparing exams, and even you study hard, some questions are not covered in lectures, powerpoints. So, good luck!

reviews.author: calcguy
reviews.comment_content:
Before Midterm (Taught by Dr. Ice Ko):
1. Energy, Matter, and Resources in the Environment
2. Earth's Major Biomes
3. Biodiversity and Its Threats
4. Human Populations and Ecological Footprint
5. Food Security and Nutrition

After Midterm (Taught by Prof Wang):
1. Atmosphere and Climate
2. Greenhouse Gases
3. Air Pollution
4. Water Resource and Cycle
5. Water Shortage, Eutrophication and Hypoxia
6. Water Pollution
7. Environmental Health
8. Environmental Toxicology
9. Biomonitoring

Major Reference:
Cunningham, W.P. and Cunningham, M.A. (2017) Principles of Environmental Science: Inquiry and Application. Eighth Edition. McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Before Midterm:
She explains things in a good way, it is easy to understand what she is talking about, as long as you bear with her for the entire lecture. From the other comments, she prohibits students from using the phones and take photos from her slides. Note that each topic may last for 2-3 lectures. Exam questions may contain past paper questions and whatever she mentions during all the lecture.

After Midterm:
I only went to his lecture once. The reason is that I cannot really understand what he is trying to explain, and his English is far off Dr. Ko's. I myself read the textbook about 1 week before the exam (so that I don't have to memorize each and every detail in the lecture notes, though his lecture notes are pretty short (about 20 slides).) But I guess it didn't work really well for me in the finals.

P.S.: Some people mention that past paper is critical. I somewhat agree to this statement. The past paper that people mean is actually available in peter gao's website (under course BISC003).
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm Examination (about 50%) : 60 MCQs
- Mean = 42.6 / 60
- SD = 7.1 / 60
- Me : 36/60

Final Examination (about 50%) : 7 Short Qs ONLY
- Mean = 70.0 / 100
- SD = 19.6 / 100
- Me : 59/100

As usual, getting a total score above mean will lead to B- or better, and getting a total score below mean will lead to C+ or worse. I myself got a C, kinda disappointed.
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignments, but I personally need to read the textbook whenever I missed the lectures. Details in the lecture notes are pretty vague, so if you really want to understand each topic well, go read the textbook.

The textbook can be borrowed from the library.

reviews.author: Kingsman
reviews.title: Worst choice for common core
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces students to the general concepts of environment, natural resources, and sustainable development. The topics include pressing global, regional and local environmental changes; life-supporting systems of our planet; biodiversity and its conservation; atmosphere, water resources, and their pollutions; solid and hazardous waste management; environmental health and sustainable development. Throughout the course, students will gain a sufficient background and a better understanding of the root-causes of the upfront environmental issues. They will also become more aware of their role, as citizens, in environmental protection and sustainable development.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very very boring
reviews.comment_grading: My midterm score was below mean by 2 marks and I got C finally. My friends midterm score was above mean and he also got C. No statistics for final exam and essay. You won't know your own final score and overall score.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload.

reviews.author: hayden tse

幾似中學地理
氣候、生態、環境、資源、水質、人口、飢餓都講下，內容唔算悶

評論2個鐘就寫好

reviews.author: cct

reviews.author: kero星人
reviews.comment_content:
as an SSC S&T，同phys1003差唔多，有chem嘢，bio嘢，geog嘢[environmental science is an interdisciplinary subject :)))]
無chem底比較慘，因為會講chemical equation (final考咗1題long question 5分)
我無geog bio底覺得content可接受

p.s.呢科唔使買textbook
reviews.comment_teaching:
ice教得吾錯，速度比cindy慢好多，講得清楚，鍾意上堂播片 (video內容會考)，同埋會講人生道理保護環境。{佢話自己啱啱病完返嚟教書，唔係傳說中咁西面，仲會搞get｝
cindy ppt超多，tone比較flat，每堂讀成百版ppt係佢技能，不過佢會講考試考咩而唔係fake你
佢哋兩個嘅ppt都唔齊，不過要抄嘅都唔係特別重要嘅嘢
佢哋話考試會考幾題guest lecture（有關中國好高端嘅深海研究），好彩最後無考到
reviews.comment_grading:
不過呢科考試無cheatsheet，即係你肯背嘢就好grade

Mid-term exam: Mean = 25.1,   s.d. = 5.6   (out of 35)
Final exam: Mean = 35.6,   s.d. = 10.8   (out 65)

scoring vs grading係fair~good，mean around B-，個人覺得個grade屬意料之內
reviews.comment_workload:
淨係2個exam，
midterm 35% (50 MC)
final 65% (50 MC+4LQ)
無assignment，無quiz，無attendence，不過final好多嘢背（midterm考好少content）
